channel.title: Neural Networks on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Neural Networks on My New Hugo Site

item.title: What are Neural Networks? Why do we use them?
item.description: Why do we use neural networks? Neural networks help us solve a lot of complicated problems when there’s no clear way to solve it. Sometimes problems can be complicated enough where we don’t know how to solve it, or solving them in conventional way will lead to very complicated algorithms which cannot adapt to changes. Neural networks play essential role in acting like human brain - helping us solving problems which we are good at: speech recognition, object recognition, pattern recognition, classification, etc…

item.title: Neural Networks: Supervised, Unsupervised & Reinforcement Learning Types of Learning
item.description: There are 3 types of learning Supervised learning Reinforcement learning Unsupervised learning Supervised Learning In supervised learning we try to predict an output when given an input vector. Input and target are clear in supervised learning. Regression - target ouptut is a real numbers or a vector of real numbers Classification - target output is a class label Model-class is a function: \begin{equation} y = f(x; W) \end{equation}

item.title: Python 2.7: Setting up Neural Network with PyBrain
item.description: Today, I’m experimenting machine learning concepts in python. For this purchase I’m using PyBrain. If you would like to have a better idea about Python, I suggest having a quick glance at posts 1-10 in Python category. PyBrain is a Machine Learning library for Python. PyBrain stands for Python-Based Reinforcemnet Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Neural Network Library. For complete guide on installation you can get complete details from: http://pybrain.org/docs/ In the example below, based on pybrain.
